title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.23| 10-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chaksharunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and setting the spiritual tone.

segments.key_quote: Here is the same Supreme Personality of Godhead whose transcendental form is experienced by the great devotees who are completely cleansed of material consciousness by dint of rigid devotional service and full control of life and the senses.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.10.23) and explains that the ladies of Hastinapura, though not highly educated, are discussing Krishna, emphasizing the potential for awakening Krishna consciousness in everyone.

segments.key_quote: So we can also adopt the same method of awakening our own Krishna consciousness.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the purpose of Srimad Bhagavatam as a means to awaken Krishna consciousness, emphasizing its accessibility through translations and commentaries.

segments.key_quote: Bhaktia only by dint of pure devotional service. We can know Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on how to perceive Krishna, emphasizing the need for cleansing material consciousness through devotional service and sense control, referencing the Bhagavad Gita.

segments.key_quote: Who are able to clear the mind of all material dust by rigid devotional service can experience the Lord as he is.
segments.summary: The speaker stresses the importance of rigid devotional service as a serious practice for purifying the mind and experiencing the Lord.

segments.key_quote: Every day we have to chant and hear Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare.
segments.summary: The speaker provides practical examples of daily devotional activities like chanting, worship, and hearing Krishna's glories, explaining how these practices purify the mind from material contamination accumulated over lifetimes.

segments.key_quote: Until then our material existence continues life after life after life after life after life.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts material activities with devotional service, highlighting that only through contact with a pure devotee and acceptance of devotional service can one break free from the cycle of birth and death, emphasizing the human form's potential for understanding one's relationship with Krishna.

segments.key_quote: The reality is that these senses if they are controlled and engaged in devotional service only then can we become really happy.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the concept of 'Jita Indriya' (sense control) and contrasts it with 'Ajita Indriya' (uncontrolled senses), arguing that true happiness comes from engaging the senses in devotional service rather than suppressing them, using the example of Vishwamitra Muni to illustrate the failure of artificial sense control methods.
